story.text: Jan 2 Presstek Inc. PRST.O said it discontinued analog newspaper plate business, resulting in job losses at its South Hadley, Massachusetts, facility and a $7.14 million charge in the fourth quarter of 2006. The production of Precision-branded analog aluminum plates was interrupted after a chemical release at the South Hadley facility in October, the digital imaging technology company said in a statement. The analog newspaper products and market were not consistent with the company's strategy to focus on advanced products and did not provide a meaningful contribution to its earnings, the statement said. The company expects fourth-quarter revenue from Precision analog plate to be below $1 million compared with $3.3 million in the September quarter. Presstek expects the discontinued operations to have a negligible negative impact on 2007 earnings. The decision to stop the operation will not affect the production of digital plates in a separate but adjacent facility at the South Hadley complex, the company added. (Reporting by Rakesh Dubey in Bangalore)
story.title: update 1 - presstek stops analog newspaper plate business
